Hello!I'm Michael,

a full stack web developer based in Manchester, UK.

Passionate about building websites and apps with a variety of technologies, I enjoy designing the visual elements of the front end and the backend inner workings equally.

My skillset includes Javascript, ReactJS, VueJS, NodeJS and database technologies including MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Take a look at some of my projects below and don't hesitate to get in touch!

Projects

Green Oil

Custom built e-commerce website based on a sustainable bicycle oil company, using a PayPal payment API.

I visited Green Oil's website whilst looking for eco friendly oil for maintaining my bike. I saw it was in need of a redesign and realised it was a great project to take on to learn more about online payment integration.

This project gave me a great insight into integrating payment, using PayPal on this occasion. I also added the option to toggle between two currencies.

VIEW CODE VIEW LIVE

MACA

Website for vegan animal activism group 'Manchester Animal Climate Action'.

MACA were in need of a website overhaul as their original site had styling and layout issues and was very unresponsive.

I built this new website using VueJS, basing the content on their original site, but restructuring for easier navigation and better responsiveness for various devices.

VIEW CODE VIEW LIVE

Medical Illustration Database

Full stack database solution built using ReactJS, NodeJS and Postgresql.

This was built to replace an old MS Access database which had been in use since the mid 90s.

Probably my most complex project to date, but also the most enjoyable beneficial as I really got my head around the full capabilities of React.

I initially took a class based approach to building the app, but later on rebuilt it using React Hooks and Redux.

Rediscovering my love of coding

I first discovered a love of computers and more specifically programming, when I was in my early teens. The first language I taught myself was Visual Basic, using a book called 'Sams Teach Yourself Visual Basic In 24 Hours'. I took that book everywhere with me. This lead onto an interest in C++ and soon after Assembly. There was of course also HTML which I experimented with on and off.

At some point my interest turned to photography, although I always kept a hand in programming and web design, tinkering with the odd project from time to time and building the occasional website for friends and colleagues. Now, with over ten years working as a clinical photographer in the National Health Service, I find myself being drawn back to my life long love of computer programming.

My experience lies primarily in the following technologies:

  • HTML and CSS
  • PHP
  • Javascript
  • ReactJS + Redux
  • VueJS + Vuex
  • NodeJS
  • Postgresql
However I continue to enjoy learning new skills and experimenting with technologies as I discover them.

Design Skills

Having trained and worked as a photographer and videographer, I also have extensive experience using creative editing software, in particular Adobe products including Photoshop and Premiere Pro. I also have extensive experience using similar software such as Final Cut Pro.

To see some of my work take a look at theProjects page and please get in touch if you'd like to collaborate or find out more.
